entity.name: `popover` attribute (Popover API)
entity.description: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionClean: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.

example.code: Popover content
example.codeHighlighted: <button popovertarget="foo">Toggle the popover</button> <div id="foo" popover>Popover content</div>

resources.title: The Popover API (previously Popup) · Issue #743 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
webFeature.name: Popover

example.codeHighlighted: .anchor { anchor-name: --my-anchor; } .target { position: absolute; position-anchor: --my-anchor; position-area: start end; }

resources.title: Tether elements to each other with CSS anchor positioning

webFeature.description_html: Anchor positioning places an element based on the position of another element. For example, you can place a tooltip next to the content it references.
webFeature.name: Anchor positioning

resources.title: Smooth and simple transitions with the View Transitions API

webFeature.description_html: The @view-transition CSS rule sets whether a document opts-in to transitions between documents in a multi-page application. Both the old and new document must opt-in for a transition to be triggered.
webFeature.name: Cross-document view transitions

entity.name: `<dialog>`
entity.description: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
entity.descriptionClean: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.

example.code:
<dialog id="confirm">
	<form method="dialog">
		Are you sure?
		<button value="1">Yes</button>
		<button value="0">No</button>
	</form>
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <dialog id="confirm"> <form method="dialog"> Are you sure? <button value="1">Yes</button> <button value="0">No</button> </form> </dialog>

webFeature.description_html: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
webFeature.name: <dialog>

entity.name: File System Access API
entity.description: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.
entity.descriptionHtml: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.
entity.descriptionClean: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.

example.codeHighlighted: const handle = await window.showSaveFilePicker(); const writable = await handle.createWritable(); await writable.write("Hello, world!"); await writable.close();

webFeature.description_html: The showOpenFilePicker(), showDirectoryPicker(), and showSaveFilePicker() methods request access to files and directories on the user's device and returns a handle for reading and writing to them.
webFeature.name: File system access

example.codeHighlighted: html { scroll-timeline: --page-scroll block; } @keyframes grow-progress { from { transform: scaleX(0); } to { transform: scaleX(1); } } #progress { animation: grow-progress auto linear; animation-timeline: --page-scroll; }

resources.title: Unleash the Power of Scroll-Driven Animations
Animate elements on scroll with Scroll-driven animations

webFeature.description_html: The animation-timeline, scroll-timeline, and view-timeline CSS properties advance animations based on the user's scroll position.
webFeature.name: Scroll-driven animations

resources.title: Create a color theme with CSS Relative Color Syntax, CSS color-mix(), and CSS color-contrast()

webFeature.description_html: The from keyword for color functions (color(), hsl(), oklch(), etc.) creates a new color based on a given color by modifying the values of the input color. Also known as relative color syntax (RCS).
webFeature.name: Relative colors

entity.descriptionClean: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.

entity.name: HTML Modules

entity.descriptionClean: Import HTML files via JS imports and access their elements and JS exports.

<script type="module">
	import { TabList } from "./tablist.html" with { type: 'html' };

</script>

entity.name: `<details>` and `<summary>`

entity.descriptionClean: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.

example.codeHighlighted: <details> <summary>Details</summary> Longer content </details>

webFeature.description_html: The <details> element is a disclosure widget which can be expanded to reveal additional content. When closed, only the nested <summary> element is visible.
webFeature.name: <details>

entity.name: `input.showPicker()`
entity.description: Programmatically open the picker of form controls that have one (color pickers, date inputs etc).
entity.descriptionClean: Programmatically open the picker of form controls that have one (color pickers, date inputs etc).

example.codeHighlighted: <input id="dateInput" type="date"> <button onclick="dateInput.showPicker()">Select date</button>

webFeature.description_html: The showPicker() method for <input> elements shows the user interface for picking a value. For example, for <input type="date"> it shows the interface for picking a date.
webFeature.name: showPicker() for <input>

example.codeHighlighted: a:has(> img) { border: 2px solid grey; }

webFeature.description_html: The :has() CSS functional pseudo-class matches an element if any of the selectors passed as parameters would match at least one element.
webFeature.name: :has()

example.codeHighlighted: .square { aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; }

webFeature.description_html: The aspect-ratio CSS property controls the width-to-height ratio of elements. For <img> and <video> elements, the width and height attributes used together with height: auto control the aspect ratio while the image/video is loading.
webFeature.name: aspect-ratio

example.codeHighlighted: .box { backdrop-filter: blur(10px); }

webFeature.description_html: The backdrop-filter CSS property applies graphical effects such as blurring or color shifting to the area behind an element.
webFeature.name: backdrop-filter

example.codeHighlighted: p { display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; }

webFeature.description_html: The line-clamp CSS property limits the text in a block container to a certain number of lines. The prefixed -webkit-line-clamp is widely supported but only works with -webkit-box-orient: vertical in combination with display: -webkit-box or display: -webkit-inline-box.
webFeature.name: line-clamp

example.codeHighlighted: /* Targets all even-numbered pages */ @page :left { margin-top: 4in; }

webFeature.description_html: The @page CSS at-rule sets the page-specific dimensions and margins for content such as printed documents, ebooks, or slides.
webFeature.name: Page setup

entity.name: Discrete Properties Animations
entity.description: Animate to and from properties such as `display: none`
entity.descriptionHtml: Animate to and from properties such as display: none
entity.descriptionClean: Animate to and from properties such as display: none

example.codeHighlighted: /* IS-OPEN STATE */ dialog[open] { translate: 0 0; } /* EXIT STATE */ dialog { transition: opacity 1s, display 1s allow-discrete, overlay 1s allow-discrete; translate: 0 100vh; } /* 0. BEFORE-OPEN STATE */ @starting-style { dialog[open] { translate: 0 100vh; } }

webFeature.description_html: The transition-behavior: allow-discrete CSS declaration allows transitions for properties whose animation behavior is discrete. Such properties can't be interpolated and swap from their start value to the end value at 50%.
webFeature.name: transition-behavior

example.codeHighlighted: input[type='checkbox'] { accent-color: tomato; }

webFeature.description_html: The accent-color CSS property sets a color for checkboxes, radio buttons, and other form controls.
webFeature.name: accent-color

entity.name: CSS Custom Highlight API
entity.description: Provides a mechanism for styling arbitrary text ranges on a document by using JavaScript to create the ranges, and CSS to style them.
entity.descriptionClean: Provides a mechanism for styling arbitrary text ranges on a document by using JavaScript to create the ranges, and CSS to style them.

example.codeHighlighted: // css ::highlight(my-custom-highlight) { background-color: blue; } // js const parentNode = document.getElementById("foo"); const range1 = new Range(); range1.setStart(parentNode, 10); range1.setEnd(parentNode, 20); const highlight = new Highlight(range1); CSS.highlights.set("my-custom-highlight", highlight);

webFeature.description_html: Custom highlights style arbitrary text ranges, without adding extra elements to the DOM.
webFeature.name: Custom highlights

webFeature.description_html: The shadowrootmode attribute on <template> creates a shadow root without the use of JavaScript. It is a declarative alternative to the attachShadow() method.
webFeature.name: Declarative shadow DOM

entity.name: Wide Gamut Colors
entity.description: `lch()`, `lab()`, `oklch()`, `oklab()`
entity.descriptionHtml: lch(), lab(), oklch(), oklab()
entity.descriptionClean: lch(), lab(), oklch(), oklab()

example.codeHighlighted: .foo { background-color: lab(29.2345% 39.3825 20.0664); background-color: lch(29.2345% 44.2 27); }

webFeature.description_html: The Oklab color space expresses colors in terms of lightness and how red/green and blue/yellow a color is, aiming to match how humans perceive colors. Oklch is a variant of Oklab with polar coordinates. These color spaces can be used with the CSS color(), oklab(), and oklch() functions.
webFeature.name: Oklab and Oklch

entity.name: Masonry Layout
entity.description: Native support for Pinterest-style free-flowing grid layouts.
entity.descriptionClean: Native support for Pinterest-style free-flowing grid layouts.

webFeature.description_html: Masonry is a type of CSS grid layout where the items on one of the axes are tightly packed together, like brickwork, instead of leaving gaps to align across the other axis.
webFeature.name: Masonry

entity.descriptionClean: Assign hidden semantics to custom elements, facilitating accessibility and allowing them to participate fully in forms.

entity.name: `<details name>` (Exclusive Accordion)

entity.descriptionHtml: Group <details> elements so that only up to one in the group can be open at a time.

</details>

</details>

webFeature.description_html: Multiple <details> elements which use the same name attribute are mutually exclusive. When one member of the group is opened, all other members are closed.
webFeature.name: Mutually exclusive <details> elements

entity.name: `Intl.Segmenter` API

example.codeHighlighted: const segmenterFr = new Intl.Segmenter("fr", { granularity: "word" }); const string1 = "Que ma joie demeure"; const iterator1 = segmenterFr.segment(string1)[Symbol.iterator](); console.log(iterator1.next().value.segment); // Expected output: 'Que' console.log(iterator1.next().value.segment); // Expected output: ' '

entity.name: Shadow DOM

entity.name: Content-Security Policy (CSP)

It consists of a set of directives from a website to a browser, which instruct the browser to restrict the things that the site is allowed to do.

entity.descriptionHtml: Animate to and from properties such as display: none

example.codeHighlighted: /* IS-OPEN STATE */ dialog[open] { translate: 0 0; } /* EXIT STATE */ dialog { transition: opacity 1s, display 1s allow-discrete, overlay 1s allow-discrete; translate: 0 100vh; } /* 0. BEFORE-OPEN STATE */ @starting-style { dialog[open] { translate: 0 100vh; } }

webFeature.description_html: The transition-behavior: allow-discrete CSS declaration allows transitions for properties whose animation behavior is discrete. Such properties can't be interpolated and swap from their start value to the end value at 50%.
webFeature.name: transition-behavior

entity.name: `popover="hint"`

entity.name: WebGL

entity.descriptionClean: A low-level API for rendering 2D and 3D graphics with the GPU on <canvas> , based on OpenGL.

example.codeHighlighted: const gl = canvas.getContext("webgl");

webFeature.description_html: The WebGLRenderingContext API is the "webgl" rendering context for the <canvas> element. It represents a space for drawing two- and three-dimensional graphics and animations.
webFeature.name: WebGL

entity.name: Line Breaking Properties
entity.description: `overflow-wrap`, `word-break`, `line-break`, `hyphens`
entity.descriptionHtml: overflow-wrap, word-break, line-break, hyphens
entity.descriptionClean: overflow-wrap, word-break, line-break, hyphens

example.codeHighlighted: .high-contrast { color: color-contrast(#008080 vs olive, var(--myColor), #d2691e); }

entity.name: Masonry Layout
entity.description: Native support for Pinterest-style free-flowing grid layouts.
entity.descriptionClean: Native support for Pinterest-style free-flowing grid layouts.

webFeature.description_html: Masonry is a type of CSS grid layout where the items on one of the axes are tightly packed together, like brickwork, instead of leaving gaps to align across the other axis.
webFeature.name: Masonry

entity.name: Form validation
entity.description: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (`<input pattern>`, `<input required>`, `input. setCustomValidity(msg)` etc)
entity.descriptionHtml: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (<input pattern>, <input required>, input. setCustomValidity(msg) etc)
entity.descriptionClean: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (<input pattern>, <input required>, input. setCustomValidity(msg) etc)

example.codeHighlighted: <input id="zip" pattern="[0-9]{5}" title="5 digits" required />

entity.name: WebUSB API
entity.description: Directly communicate with USB devices, enabling data exchange without drivers or native apps.
entity.descriptionClean: Directly communicate with USB devices, enabling data exchange without drivers or native apps.

example.code:
const device = await navigator.usb.requestDevice({ filters: [{ vendorId: 0x2341 }] });
await device.open();
example.codeHighlighted: const device = await navigator.usb.requestDevice({ filters: [{ vendorId: 0x2341 }] }); await device.open();

resources.title: Access USB Devices on the Web

webFeature.description_html: The WebUSB API exposes USB compatible devices to web pages.
webFeature.name: WebUSB

webFeature.description_html: The WebRTC API establishes real-time communication channels directly between browsers. It is commonly used in video conferencing applications.
webFeature.name: WebRTC

example.codeHighlighted: @media (prefers-color-scheme: dark) { .foo { background: #333; color: white; } }

webFeature.description_html: The prefers-color-scheme CSS media query sets styles based on the requested color scheme, light or dark.
webFeature.name: prefers-color-scheme media query

entity.name: `parseHtmlUnsafe()`
entity.description: Used to parse a string of HTML, which may contain declarative shadow roots, in order to create a new Document instance.
entity.descriptionClean: Used to parse a string of HTML, which may contain declarative shadow roots, in order to create a new Document instance.

example.codeHighlighted: Document.parseHTMLUnsafe(input)
.wrapper { display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; } .item { grid-row: 1 / 4; display: grid; grid-template-rows: subgrid; }

webFeature.description_html: The subgrid value for the grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows properties allows a grid item to inherit the grid definition of its parent grid container.
webFeature.name: Subgrid

entity.name: `input.showPicker()`
entity.description: Programmatically open the picker of form controls that have one (color pickers, date inputs etc).
entity.descriptionClean: Programmatically open the picker of form controls that have one (color pickers, date inputs etc).

example.codeHighlighted: <input id="dateInput" type="date"> <button onclick="dateInput.showPicker()">Select date</button>

webFeature.description_html: The showPicker() method for <input> elements shows the user interface for picking a value. For example, for <input type="date"> it shows the interface for picking a date.
webFeature.name: showPicker() for <input>

entity.name: `command` and `commandfor` attributes (Command Invokers)
entity.description: A declarative way for `<button>` to invoke predefined custom commands.
entity.descriptionHtml: A declarative way for <button> to invoke predefined custom commands.
entity.descriptionClean: A declarative way for <button> to invoke predefined custom commands.

example.code:
<button commandfor="mydialog" command="show-modal">
  Show modal dialog
</button>
<dialog id="mydialog">
  <button commandfor="mydialog" command="close">
    Close
  </button>
  *dialog content*
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <button commandfor="mydialog" command="show-modal"> Show modal dialog </button> <dialog id="mydialog"> <button commandfor="mydialog" command="close"> Close </button> *dialog content* </dialog>

resources.title: Invoker Commands: Additional Ways to Work With Dialog, Popover… and More?

webFeature.description_html: The command and commandfor attributes for the <button> HTML element dispatch an action to an element when the button is invoked (by click or keystroke), as a declarative alternative to addEventListener() calls or onclick attribute handlers.
webFeature.name: Invoker commands

entity.name: Shadow DOM
entity.description: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.
entity.descriptionClean: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.

example.codeHighlighted: this.shadowRoot = this.attachShadow({mode: "open"});

webFeature.description_html: Shadow DOM allows you to attach encapsulated "shadow" DOM trees to elements. A shadow DOM tree is a separate component, isolated from the scripts and styles in other parts of the document. This is a part of Web Components.
webFeature.name: Shadow DOM

entity.name: Navigation API
entity.description: Initiate, intercept, and manage navigation actions, examine history entries. Successor to the older `history` and `location` APIs.
entity.descriptionHtml: Initiate, intercept, and manage navigation actions, examine history entries. Successor to the older history and location APIs.
entity.descriptionClean: Initiate, intercept, and manage navigation actions, examine history entries. Successor to the older history and location APIs.

example.codeHighlighted: navigation.navigate(url, {history: "push"}); navigation.addEventListener("navigate", interceptNavigation);

resources.title: The navigation API has moved to the HTML Standard
GitHub - WICG/navigation-api: The new navigation API provides a new interface for navigations and session history, with a focus on single-page application navigations.

entity.name: ``
entity.description: The `sizes="auto"` attribute reserves layout space for an image before it loads, avoiding some layout shifts.
entity.descriptionHtml: The sizes="auto" attribute reserves layout space for an image before it loads, avoiding some layout shifts.
entity.descriptionClean: The sizes="auto" attribute reserves layout space for an image before it loads, avoiding some layout shifts.

webFeature.description_html: The sizes="auto" attribute for the <img> HTML element reserves layout space for an image before it loads, avoiding some layout shifts. This attribute only applies to images with the loading="lazy" attribute.
The navigator.getGamepads() API accesses and responds to signals from game controllers.
webFeature.name: Gamepad

entity.name: Signals
entity.description: Used in reactive programming to remove the need to manage updating in applications.
entity.descriptionClean: Used in reactive programming to remove the need to manage updating in applications.

entity.name: `<dialog closedby="any">`
entity.description: Allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it (light dismiss).
entity.descriptionClean: Allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it (light dismiss).

webFeature.description_html: The closedby HTML attribute for <dialog> sets which user actions close a dialog. For example, closedby="any" allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it.
webFeature.name: <dialog closedby>

example.codeHighlighted: <video src="video.mp4" controls></video>

entity.name: `ElementInternals`
entity.description: Assign hidden semantics to custom elements, facilitating accessibility and allowing them to participate fully in forms.
entity.descriptionClean: Assign hidden semantics to custom elements, facilitating accessibility and allowing them to participate fully in forms.

example.codeHighlighted: this._internals = this.attachInternals(); this._internals.role = "progressbar";

webFeature.description_html: Custom elements may act like built-in form elements, via the the attachInternals() method of HTMLElement and the ElementInternals API.
webFeature.name: Form-associated custom elements

example.codeHighlighted: .image{ filter: blur(5px) }

entity.name: HTML imports
entity.description: Lack of native HTML imports or templating
entity.descriptionClean: Lack of native HTML imports or templating

entity.name: `hidden="until-found"`
entity.description: Hide an element until it is found (e.g. via a find-in-page search or when targeted by the URL hash).
entity.descriptionClean: Hide an element until it is found (e.g. via a find-in-page search or when targeted by the URL hash).

example.codeHighlighted: <section class="drawer" aria-expanded="false" hidden="until-found"> <!-- content --> </section>

resources.title: Making collapsed content accessible with hidden=until-found

webFeature.description_html: The hidden="until-found" attribute hides an element until it is found using the browser's find-in-page search or it is directly navigated to by following a URL fragment.
webFeature.name: hidden="until-found"

example.codeHighlighted: p { text-box-edge: cap alphabetic; text-box-trim: trim-both; }

resources.title: Leading-Trim: The Future of Digital Typesetting
